Django Dumpdata To Dump Selective Rows

Posted by Sandeep Raju on August 22, 2013

Thanks to my telephony geek friend for letting me know this simple but highly useful method to selectively dump django models data into a django standard model-dump format. Here is a simple snippet which shows how to selectively dump only the required rows and not the entire model.

 1 from django.core import serializers
 2 
 3 # Generate a queryset depending on whatever you need
 4 query_set = YourModel.objects.all()[:2000]  # selecting only first 2k rows
 5 
 6 # Serialize the queryset into JSON with indentation of 4 spaces
 7 json_data = serializers.serialize("json", query_set, indent=4)
 8 
 9 # Dump the json data into a file
10 output_file = open('YourModel.json', 'w')
11 output_file.write(json_data)
12 output_file.close()

Works like a charm!

Happy coding :)
